p: All HFMD patients with laboratory-confirmed EV infection at the Paediatric Department of Guangdong Women and Children Hospital between January 2018 and December were included in this study. Demographic data (sex and age range) and clinical manifestations (cough, diarrhea, vomiting, fever spike, neurologic complications, and skin lesions) were collected. Laboratory data, including hypersensitive C-reactive protein (hsCRP), white blood cell (WBC), neutrophils, lymphocyte, platelet (PLT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), creatine kinase (CK), creatine kinase-MB (CK-MB), were also collected.
